title: FOIA/CPRA Submission: Ventura County Sheriff Assault Response – Block & Santos (April 2025)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: FOIA/CPRA Submission: Ventura County Sheriff Assault Response – Block & Santos (April 2025)
communications.communication:
To:
Ventura County Sheriff’s Office
Public Records Unit
800 S. Victoria Avenue
Ventura, CA 93009
Email: info.vcsd@ventura.org

From:
Jordan Lassiter

Subject: CPRA Request – Assault Incident Involving Joshua Block and Santos (April 23, 2025)

⸻

Dear Custodian of Records,

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (CPRA), Government Code §§ 6250–6276.48, and California Constitution Article I, § 3(b), I respectfully request access to public records related to an assault (non-domestic) incident involving Joshua Block and an individual identified as Santos, which occurred in Ventura County on or about April 23, 2025, at approximately 7:00 PM (19:00 hours).

⸻

Records Requested:
	1.	Body-Worn Camera Footage
	•	All body-worn camera (BWC) recordings from deputies who responded to the incident.
	2.	911 Call Audio and Transcripts
	•	All emergency call recordings and transcripts related to this incident.
	3.	CAD / Dispatch Logs
	•	Full dispatch data including unit assignments, timestamps, and call notes.
	4.	Incident and Arrest Reports
	•	All reports created in connection with this assault, including officer narratives, witness statements, investigative reports, and any arrest documentation.
	5.	Photographs or Supplemental Evidence
	•	Any digital evidence, such as photographs or surveillance obtained during the response.
	6.	Preservation Notice
	•	I formally request that all potentially responsive records be preserved, including digital and metadata. Alteration or deletion of such records after receipt of this request may constitute a violation of Gov. Code § 6200 and legal precedent such as People v. Superior Court (Barrett), 80 Cal.App.4th 1305 (2000).

⸻

Legal Justification:
	•	Gov. Code § 6254(f) provides for public access to law enforcement response records including arrest information, time, location, and substance of calls.
	•	AB 748 (Gov. Code § 6254(f)(4)) mandates the disclosure of body-worn camera footage in incidents involving the use of force or where the public interest in disclosure clearly outweighs any investigatory need for withholding.
	•	Courts in CBS v. Block, 42 Cal.3d 646 (1986) and Haynie v. Superior Court, 26 Cal.4th 1061 (2001) require narrowly tailored justifications for any denial or redaction of law enforcement records.
	•	The public’s right to information that fosters accountability is further supported by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963), and People v. Superior Court (Johnson), 61 Cal.4th 696 (2015).

⸻

Format & Fee Waiver Request:

Please provide all records in electronic format (PDF, MP4, etc.). I also request a waiver of fees under Gov. Code § 6253(e), as this request is made for public interest purposes and not commercial use.

If any fees are expected, I request a written estimate before incurring any charges.

⸻

Please acknowledge receipt of this request and provide an estimated date for completion in accordance with Gov. Code § 6253(c). I am available to assist in clarifying or narrowing this request if necessary.

Thank you for your time and commitment to transparency.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
